Detailed Description

This is the interface for text to which markup objects can be attached and detached.

Not all Spannable classes have mutable text; see Editable for that.

This is the interface for text to which markup objects can be attached and detached.

 TextWidget* tv = new TextWidget(scene);
 String* text = new String("Spanable Text");
 tv->setText(text, TextWidget::SPANNABLE);
 Spannable* s = safe_cast<Spannable*>(tv->getText());
 s->setSpan(new ForegroundColorSpan(0xFF00FF00), 0, text->length(), 0);

Member Function Documentation

gaia::text::Spannable::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( Spannable  ) [protected]
virtual void gaia::text::Spannable::removeSpan ( ObjectStyle *  what) [pure virtual]

Remove the specified object from the range of text to which it was attached, if any.

It is OK to remove an object that was never attached in the first place.

Implemented in gaia::text::SpannableStringBuilder, and gaia::text::SpannableString.

virtual void gaia::text::Spannable::setSpan ( ObjectStyle *  what,
size_t  start,
size_t  end,
int32_t  flags 
) [pure virtual]

Attach the specified markup object to the range. 

 start ... end

of the text, or move the object to that range if it was already attached elsewhere. See Spanned for an explanation of what the flags mean. The object can be one that has meaning only within your application, or it can be one that the text system will use to affect text display or behavior. Some noteworthy ones are the subclasses of text::ObjectStyle

Implemented in gaia::text::SpannableStringBuilder, and gaia::text::SpannableString.
